# Background
**Language family**: Trans–New Guinea / Dagan

# Alphabet
## Vowels
* ⟨a⟩ = /a/
* ⟨e⟩ = /e/
* ⟨i⟩ = /i/
* ⟨o⟩ = /o/
* ⟨u⟩ = /u/
## Consonants
* ⟨b⟩ = /b/
* ⟨d⟩ = /d/
* ⟨g⟩ = /g/
* ⟨k⟩ = /k/
* ⟨m⟩ = /m/
* ⟨n⟩ = /n/
* ⟨p⟩ = /p/
* ⟨r⟩ = /r/
* ⟨s⟩ = /t/
* ⟨t⟩ = /t/
* ⟨v⟩ = /w/
* ⟨w⟩ = /w/
* ⟨y⟩ = /j/

# Phonology
## Vowels
* @murane1974daga shows ⟨a⟩ as /a/ whereas @sil2011daga shows /ɑ/. The rules
will represent ⟨a⟩ as /a/.

## Consonants
* /t/ is [s] before /i/ and /e/. The rules represent ⟨s⟩ as /t/.
* /w/ is [v] before /i/ and /e/. The rules represent ⟨v⟩ as /w/.
* Free variation in the representation of ⟨r⟩, which can either be [r] or [l]. The rules represent it as /r/.

# Lenition
No information available.
